info.title: Otto Developer API
info.description: ## Authentication The Otto Developer API uses exactly the same authentication as the **Claris FileMaker Server Admin API**.

get.description:
### Check the network.
Otto servers communicate over http. There must be valid network path between them for them to communicate. This endpoint can be used to verify that the network path is valid, that is, that this server can talk to the other server.
get.summary: Verify that this server can reach another server

parameters.name: otherServerUrl
parameters.description: The url of the other server

parameters.name: isLegacy
parameters.description: is the other server running Otto 3

get.description: Get information about the Otto server and FileMaker Server.

post.description: Update Offsite Backup Settings with new S3 information

### Run a script via schedule  
Run a script using the FileMaker Scheduled Script Scripting Engine.
It is an altertantive to running a script via the Data API, oData API
or Custom Web Publishing. Unlike those, this method doesn't require an
an accoint with an extended privelege set, other than the one required
to run on a Server.  

The Schedule will be created, run and then deleted.

get.description: Calling this endpoint will make a copy or clone of a file and start streaming the file back to the client.
get.summary: Download a file from FileMaker Server

get.description: Calling this endpoint will make a copy or clone of a file and send back a link which can be used to download a zip of the file.
Download a file using a download url
List all builds on the server

### Download a build zip using a download url
The download url is a signed url that can be used to download a build zip. This endpoint will return a 404 if the build does not exist.

The url can be obtained from the `Get Build Status` endpoint.

### Download a zip containing the build folder using a download url
The download url is a signed url that can be used to download a build zip. This endpoint will return a 404 if the build does not exist.

The url can be obtained from the `Get Build Status` endpoint.

### Stream a build zip
Stream a build zip from the server. This endpoint will return a 404 if the build does not exist.
Returns the Deployment data for the given deployment Id

post.description: Use this endpoint to start a deployment. The deployment will be started asynchronously and you can use the `/deployments` endpoint to check the status of the deployment.
Restores the backup created before the given deployment Id to

### Start, stop and restart various FileMaker Server processes.

**Caution:** Restarting or Stopping a process will kill anything that might be running on that process. Use with caution.

The `service` property can be one of the following:
- `wpe`
- `fmse`
- `adminserver`
- `httpserver`
- `fmsib`
- `xdbc`
- `server` - requires HTTP Basic Auth
- `fmdapi`
- `odata`

The `command` property can be one of the following:
- `start`
- `stop`
- `restart`

### Create an Otto Admin Api Key

This endpoint creates an Admin API Key for the FileMaker Server with the specified user and password.

### Create an Otto Api Key

This endpoint creates an API Key for the FileMaker file with the specified user and password.

type.description: Fetches a build from a URL
Fetches files from the local file system's uploads folder
Fetches files from a backup of a previous deployment
Fetches a build from another Otto v4 server
Produces a just in time build on another Otto v4 server and fetches it

name.description: Name of the FileMaker Script to run

param.description: Text string passed to the FileMaker Script

stopBuildOnFail.description: if true and the script doesn't complete successfully, then the build will fail.

buildOptions.description: The build options that get passed along to the source server

type.description: Fetches clones from an Otto v3 server

name.description: Descriptive name for the deployment (appears in UI)
Name of the FileMaker Script to run

param.description: Text string passed to the FileMaker Script

rollbackIfScriptFails.description: if true and the Script doesn't complete successfully, then the deployment will be rolled back.

postDeploymentScript.description: A script to run after the deployment is complete.

clone.description: The FileMaker clone from the source that provides the new schema

dataSource.description: The FileMaker file that will provide the data for the migration.

target.description: The final name of file after it is has been migrated file and deployed

dataMigrationOptions.description: Additional options for the FileMaker Data Migration Tool

overwrite.description: If `true`, will replace the existing file if it exists.

source.description: The file from the source to install

fileName.description: The final name of the installed file when it is deployed

subFolder.description: The subfolder to install into. Not allowed with "secure" folder.

source.description: The file to be deployed to replace the target

target.description: The file that will be replaced by the source

The file to be closed for the duration of the deployment. This is useful for files that are not being deployed, but may access files that are being deployed. Closing it will prevent users or scheduled scripts from accessing it during the deployment.

fileOperations.description: Array of file operations to run in the deployment

tags.name: FileMaker Files
tags.description: Actions that can be performed on a FileMaker files

tags.name: Deployment
tags.description: Deployments are the process of *deploying* files to a FileMaker Server. Each deployment can have multiple files. Each file can be either a new file or an existing file. If the file already exists on the server, it can be replaced or the data can be migrated into the new file using the Data Migration Tool.

tags.name: API Keys
tags.description: API Keys are used as a proxy for the FileMaker Data API.

tags.name: Admin API Keys
tags.description: Admin API Keys are used as a proxy to the FileMaker Server Admin API
